com.android.smoketest

Class ProcessErrorsTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • android.test.AndroidTestCase
        • com.android.smoketest.ProcessErrorsTest

  • public class ProcessErrorsTest
extends android.test.AndroidTestCase
    This smoke test is designed to check for crashes and ANRs in an attempt to quickly determine if all minimal functionality in the build is working properly.

      • testZZReportAsyncErrors

        public void testZZReportAsyncErrors()
                             throws java.lang.Exception
        This test checks for asynchronously-caused errors (crashes or ANRs) and fails in case any were found. This prevents us from needing to fail unrelated testcases when, for instance a background thread causes a crash or ANR.

        Because this behavior depends on the contents of static member mAsyncErrors, we clear that state here as a side-effect so that if two successive runs happen in the same process, the asynchronous errors in the second test run won't include errors produced during the first run.

        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • runOneActivity

        public java.util.Collection<com.android.smoketest.ProcessErrorsTest.ProcessError> runOneActivity(android.content.pm.ResolveInfo app)
        A method to run the specified Activity and return a Collection of the Activities that were in an error state, as listed by ActivityManager.getProcessesInErrorState().

        The method will launch the app, wait for 7 seconds, check for apps in the error state, send the Home intent, wait for 2 seconds, and then return.
